publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-3386 Mr Stewart Maxwell: Freedom of Glasgow for Harry Benson—That the Parliament recognises the immense contribution of Harry Benson, one of Glasgow’s most famous sons and one of the world’s foremost photographers; agrees that his images of some of the most famous people and historic events of the second half of the 20th century are a priceless record of those decades; believes that, in recognition of his contribution to art, photography and historical record, the city of Glasgow should honour his lifetime of achievement, and calls on Glasgow City Council to award Harry Benson the freedom of the city.

S2M-3386 Freedom of Glasgow for Harry Benson (lodged on 4 October 2005) Ms Sandra White*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Jim Mather*, Mr David Davidson*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Rob Gibson*, Mr John Swinney*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*, Frances Curran*, Michael Matheson*, Fiona Hyslop*
S2M-3386 Freedom of Glasgow for Harry Benson (lodged on 4 October 2005) Alex Neil*

S2M-3386 Mr Stewart Maxwell: Freedom of Glasgow for Harry Benson—That the Parliament recognises the immense contribution of Harry Benson, one of Glasgow’s most famous sons and one of the world’s foremost photographers; agrees that his images of some of the most famous people and historic events of the second half of the 20th century are a priceless record of those decades; believes that, in recognition of his contribution to art, photography and historical record, the city of Glasgow should honour his lifetime of achievement, and calls on Glasgow City Council to award Harry Benson the freedom of the city. Supported by: Ms Sandra White, Nicola Sturgeon, Mr Kenny MacAskill, Jim Mather, Mr David Davidson, Mr Adam Ingram, Rob Gibson, Mr John Swinney, Mrs Margaret Ewing, Frances Curran, Michael Matheson, Fiona Hyslop, Alex Neil, Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-3386 Freedom of Glasgow for Harry Benson (lodged on 4 October 2005) Patrick Harvie*
